title: Incidental Learning-Based Categorical Clustering Language Acquisition Strategy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental language structures and classification systems
context.additional_context: Learners develop language categorization skills through pattern recognition in natural exposure environments without intentional memorization of categories.

learning_goals: Learners can identify potential categorical structures of given linguistic materials with 80% accuracy
Learners can explain relationships between language categories discovered in incidental learning environments with three or more concrete examples
Learners can improve free-recall accuracy of linguistic materials by 25% compared to baseline using category clustering strategies

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
